caption.center: Clyde M. Ledford, Martha Ledford, Fred E. Ledford, and Brenda Ledford v. H.
Charles Engle, etc., Alice S. Shelley, and Neil T. Koenig.

court.center: Court of Civil Appeals of Alabama.

opinion.posture:
Appeal from Shelby Circuit Court (CV-97-113). Oliver P. Head, Circuit Judge.
On Remand from the Supreme Court
opinion.attorneys:
Roger D. Burton and Charles Boohaker of Roger D. Burton, P.C., Birmingham, for appellant.
Bruce M. Green, Pelham; and Elliot C. Herrin, Birmingham, for appellee.
Bruce M. Green and Elliot C. Herrin, for appellee.
opinion.opinion_text:
This court, on March 12, 1999, affirmed the trial court's judgment, without an opinion. Ledford v. Engle, (No. 2971041) ___ So.2d ___ (Ala.Civ.App. 1999) (table). The Alabama Supreme Court has reversed this court's judgment insofar as it affirmed the summary judgment on the claim relatingPage 996 to the validity of the agreements to compensate Engle, and the case has been remanded to this court. Ex parte Ledford, 761 So.2d 990 (Ala. 2000). In compliance with the Supreme Court's opinion, the judgment of the trial court as to the aforesaid claim is reversed and the case is remanded. The trial court is directed to determine what portion, if any, of the $35,700 constituted fees or other payment for those services mentioned in ยง 34-27-30, Ala. Code 1975, services for which Engle could not legally charge.
REVERSED IN PART AND REMANDED WITH INSTRUCTIONS.
Robertson, P.J., and Monroe, Crawley, and Thompson, JJ., concur.
